column3:
Everyone else seems to have gone back to
normal, but my boyfriend's still obsessed
with Alice. Someone, please help him!

Futaba here—So there're these snake-like
Shadows in the Sendai Jail, and it looks like
they've got good weapons. I wanna find out
their weakness!
column6: Aoba St. 1st Ward and Hirose St.

column3:
The memories of battles past can improve
your strength. There is a path in the Shibuya
Jail that leads to your battle with Alice Hiiragi.
Follow it and challenge her once more.

All three of my sons keep blowing their
money on Alice crap! We're gonna lose
our house at this rate... What's it gonna
take to help them?
column6: Side path of Castle: Front Area

column3:
Trickster, have you made good use of the Velvet
Room? I shall issue you an assignment so that
you may bring out your full potential, like in the
old days.

column2: Sophia, hoping to offer more equipment
column3:
We may have reached a new city, but are we
ready for it? I'd like to offer more weapons,
but I have to make a small trade of pixie wings
to gain access to them. Care to help me out?

column2: Sophia, hoping to offer more equipment
column3:
I wish I could offer a higher-quality selection of
armor, but I have to make a trade to access
the goods. Could you help me collect some
high-quality fur from a beast?

I'm picking up a Desire in Shibuya! A smelly
underground area... A place with a bunch of
small rooms lined up. Know a spot like that?
Maybe we can track down that Desire!

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
Hey there, how's the trip going? Hope you don't
mind my hitting you up right away. I'd like to
analyze some of that mysterious junk you keep
finding. Let me know when you've got enough!

The memories of battles past can improve
your strength. There is a path in the Sendai
Jail that leads to your battle with Natsume.
It would be wise to follow it to greater heights.
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column2: A college student harangued by internet trolls
column3:
All I said was Natsume wasn't legit and now
his fans are ruining my life. They even doxxed
me! Please, help me before something horrible
happens!
column6: Sendai Station and Aoba St. 1st Ward

column2: Fox, interest piqued by a misplaced Desire
column3:
Mona sensed a Desire deep in the Sapporo Jail.
It seems quite far from the castle... could it have
gotten lost on the way to the Monarch? With
Shadows abound, we must use caution.

Are you faring well in your battles, Trickster?
I shall give you another assignment so you
may realize your full potential once more.

You know those Shadows where sex appeal's
their whole thing? Well, they're kind of a pain
so I'd like to learn their weakness. Looks like
they have some rare weapons, too. Let's do this!

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
Hey, it's your business partner, Kuon Ichinose.
My curiosity's still strong as ever about those
Metaverse finds. This is quite the research
subject! Could you bring me some new junk?
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column3:
I picked up a Desire in the Sendai Jail that
hasn't returned to its rightful owner yet.
Somewhere along the rooftops... It's tucked
away by a bunch of windows!

column2: Kuon Ichinose, ever-curious re: the Metaverse
column3:
I feel like I could study the Metaverse forever.
I'd love to learn more, so how about helping
me with an experiment? Could you tell me
what you see in there?
column6: Sapporo Clocktower and Castle: Front Area

column2: Skull, dealin' with an itchy trigger finger
column3:
You know those flyin' Shadows in Sapporo?
They're so fast, I can't shoot 'em! I wanna be
a better shot for the Monarch fight. Think you
could lend me a hand for a bit?

Do you think I'm as helpful as I can be? I am
trying my best, but I can't fight well against
those angel Shadows. Could you show me
a good way to beat them? Thank you.
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column3:
Have you been paying attention to enemies'
weaknesses? I think we'll have trouble fighting
stronger foes if we don't, so I've prepared some
lessons for you to try out.
column6: Sapporo Tower and Castle: Front Area

column3:
I presume you're continuing to attain Personas.
Keep in mind: you'll eventually find yourself
unable to fuse new ones if your strength is not
up to snuff. Do not forget your training.

The memories of battles past can improve
your strength. There is a path in the Sapporo
Jail that leads to your battle with Hyodo.
It would be wise to follow it to greater heights.

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
I wonder where you guys are now... Maybe you
reached Okinawa already? Well, wherever you
may be, you know what I'm looking for. Think
you could find some new junk for me?

I will provide you with an assignment so that
you may gain access to more complex fusions.
Be careful, Trickster—I can sense the ominous
presence growing ever closer.

*sniff sniff* I found a Desire! I bet it's one that
didn't get returned to its owner yet somehow.
It's in an area with nice, clean air... and with a
lot of trees around. Let's go track it down!
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
I saw the news about EMMA... How crazy. Well,
if you happen to find any new junk while you're
out and about, just send it my way.

I found some real icky slime Shadows in the
Okinawa Jail that I wanna check out. They seem
to eat all kinds of junk, so maybe they've got
some decent equipment in 'em! Who knows?

column2: Kuon Ichinose, ever-curious re: the Metaverse
column3:
Hi there, I thought of another experiment
I'd like conduct in the Metaverse. I could use
your help. If you do, I'll tip you off to a really
great online grocery store!
column5: Defeat 8 enemies in a single Showtime

column3:
Hmm, I can smell a Desire in the Okinawa Jail.
It's on top of a shipping container... I think we
can reach it if we use the cargo hooks. Let's go
track it down!

Have you been utilizing the triad fusion? You
need to train multiple Personas so that you can
continue to create strong Personas. I shall give
you another assignment to assist with this.
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column2: Sophia, hoping to offer more equipment
column3:
To add more weapons to the shop, I'll need to
trade in some high-quality cat whiskers. They
seem rather difficult to acquire—you'll have to
make good use of your surroundings.

column2: Sophia, hoping to offer more equipment
column3:
To add more armor to the shop, I'll need to
trade in some fine black feathers, but they are
not easy to acquire. Perhaps with Wolf's sword
at our side, we'll be able to collect enough.

column2: Oracle, unsure whether or not she's dreaming
column3:
Hey! This cool blue butterfly just floated past
me—right then, I picked up a really strong
reading in the Sendai Jail. Think we should
track it down?
column6: Side path of Castle: Front Area

column2: Panther, itching to test her phantom thief skills
column3:
With so many Shadows in the Jail, it's important
to stay hidden. If we can get to the farthest part
of the underground waterway while hidden,
we should celebrate with some shopping!

Hmm, I can smell a Desire in the Kyoto Jail, but
Akane wasn't stealing Desires... Did someone
else wander in there? It seems to be coming
from a bamboo garden...

Have you been making good use of Persona
strengthening? One can gain enough power
through this to master their domain. Well,
enough advice—here is your next assignment.
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
I've yet to see any news about the Phantom
Thieves being detained, so I'm guessing you
got away all right—if so, do you have some
Metaverse junk I could take off your hands?

column2: Fox, considering the Phantom Thieves' tenets
column3:
One of the core skills of the Phantom Thieves is
the ability to sneak. Let us hone our infiltrative
capabilities in the Sendai Jail by traversing the
area on foot without raising an alarm.

column2: Wolf, curious how the Phantom Thieves work
column3:
I know Akane's into the Phantom Thieves and
all, so I wanna find out how you do it. I mean,
not because she's interested, I just... I wanna
learn how you traverse different terrain! Yeah.

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
Enjoying Osaka? I have to say, it wouldn't be for
me (I'm not one for crowds). At any rate, you got
some more junk for me?

column2: Noir, contemplating what a phantom thief is
column3:
The most important part of being a phantom
thief is successfully sneaking, so let's work on
that. I wonder if we can successfully infiltrate
the Sapporo Jail in its entirety solely on foot?

column2: Skull, shouting about being a phantom thief
column3:
Yeah, phantom thieves do a lot of sneakin'
around, but we gotta work up a sweat every
so often too—plus, we hafta work on our sick
moves! So, let's get in that Jail and go hog wild!
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column3:
I just saw the blue butterfly again! Oh, and I
picked up a really strong reading in Juoji Zoo,
in the Osaka Jail! We should get nice and ready
if we're gonna rumble!
column5: Defeat the Guard Dog of Hades

column1: Make Way for the Frozen King
column3:
Have you been waiting with bated breath for
the next installment of the blue butterfly saga?
Well, I spotted it just now! Then, I got a strong
reading in the Arboretum, in the Sapporo Jail!

column2: Oracle, sending yet ANOTHER urgent update
column3:
Blue butterfly spotted again! You know what
that means: a strong reading, this time at the
crossing in the Shibuya Jail! I've gotta say, it
 seems especially evil, even for a Shadow...

column2: Queen, trying to focus on phantom thief affairs
column3:
You want to work on our phantom thievery...
in the Okinawa Jail? Ummm, okay... No, I'm
not scared! Let's just try and infiltrate as far
as possible WITHOUT being spotted, all right?

column2: Sophie, querying what a phantom thief truly is
column3:
You have taught me the importance of going
undetected by the enemy. Do you think we
could go unnoticed in the Kyoto Jail as well?
Please show me how the Phantom Thieves do it.
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column2: Kuon Ichinose, ever-curious re: the Metaverse
column3:
The case is over once we change Konoe's heart,
right? I wonder what'll happen to EMMA and the
Metaverse then... Haha, I guess there's no point
thinking about it. Care for another experiment?
column5: Defeat 12 enemies in a single Showtime

column3: I know we saw all those Desires leave the Osaka Jail, but I've just smelled something that makes me think there's one still left in there. It's in a place with lots of containers.

column2: Oracle, afraid to say goodbye to the RV
column3:
I've gotta say, I'm gonna miss this lil' camper...
Oh, right! I got a really strong reading from the
deepest part of the Kyoto Jail. You'd better get
as ready as you can before searching for it!

I picked up a strong reading at the end of a path
in the Okinawa Jail! It's giving me a pretty bad
feeling, but at least I know where my own path
in life is leading me—back home to Sojiro!
column5: Defeat the Throbbing King of Desire

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
So... The trip's gone a bit sideways, huh? Well,
I don't know what's going to happen to the
Metaverse, but get whatever you still can. I'd
be happy to take them off your hands.

column2: Wolf, now learned on phantom thief affairs
column3:
So, the Phantom Thieves have to go the stealthy
way, huh? Then why don'tcha show me what it
takes to get to this point here in the Osaka Jail
without raising an alarm?

If it's got sugar, I wanna try it—the more
extravagant, the better! Mind treating me
to some, [1B]S1? Pleeease?

column2: Morgana, smile hunter on the prowl
column3:
I need your help making Lady Ann smile!
I heard there's a rare dessert somewhere in
Sendai. Let's gather intel in Mt. Aoba Park!

I just HAFTA try this famous ramen in Sapporo!
I heard they sell tickets for it at "the store with
the red sign"—lemme know if you get your
hands on any!

column2: Sophia, eyes bigger than her stomach
column3:
The quickest route to meal tickets for the
renowned Sapporo ramen would be to assist
the pharmacy manager. Providing the Supple
Tentacles of 10 Shadows ought to do the trick.

For art to imitate life, one must first experience
life. This is a basic truth of humanity. Let us
make way to the Okinawa Jail, so we may
bear witness to the great Shiisaa ourselves!
column6: Research Lab and Document Storage Area

column3:
We'll have to buy a watermelon somewhere,
and I guess we can look for the tools later. First,
I'd like to warm my muscles up a bit. I know
we're rather busy, but... would you mind?

column2: Zenkichi "This is for my daughter" Hasegawa
column3:
You kids got me thinkin', I should start making
sure Akane's eating right. How about helping
with some easy recipes—you, Okumura, and
Sakura? I'm gonna steal your cooking skills!
column5: Get Haru and Futaba to teach Zenkichi cooking

column3:
I think both Zenkichi-san and Akane-chan
would appreciate some obanzai meals, but
we'll need a few more things before we can
start. Would you mind picking them up?

Kids today LOVE eating curry and ramen
together! Whip up something good and
I'll know for sure whether or not I can
serve as a proper judge in a taste test!

A violent, disturbing calamity is drawing near...
but so does hope. I know you are capable of
overcoming this trial. Allow me to provide you
with another assignment to aid your growth.

This may not be the most appropriate timing
for a request, but I believe the experience will
make your heart stronger. Please take on this
challenge so you may vanquish the calamity.

Trickster, you have come so far and gained
such great strength. Now that you've reached
this point, this could be too easy for you, but
here's an assignment for you regardless.

There's an employee here who's still basically
worshipping ex-CEO Konoe... I know it's
asking a lot, but could you please help? If you
do, I'll teach you one of the boss's own recipes.
[1B]Z
[1B]Z
[1B]Z
[1B]Z
[1B]Z

The memories of battles past can improve
your strength. There is a path in the Osaka
Jail that leads to your battle with Konoe.
It would be wise to follow it to greater heights.

column2: Oracle, looking forward to going home ASAP
column3:
I'm so P.O.ed! Nobody's destroying my home
and everyone else's on MY watch! I'm getting
a super-strong reading in the Tokyo Radio
Tower. Let's take it down and go home already!

O-O-O-Omigod, there's something in the
Okinawa Jail and its power is... Oh! Could—
Could it be!? Is this... Is it HIM!?

I can detect a Desire in the Jail of the Abyss...
somewhere. Sorry, not sure exactly where,
but I'm starting to worry about its owner.
Let's go track it down!
column8: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill
column10: Unlocks level cap for BOND skill

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
I know making a request at a time like this is
rather odd, but I think I have something that'll
do you some good. I'll trade it for a certain type
of junk. I'd really appreciate the effort.

As the one who taught you the skills of the
trade, I thought I might put you to the test!
Think you can infiltrate this especially nasty
Jail without any problems?

I can smell a Desire inside the Tokyo Radio
Tower. I don't know exactly where, though—
it's hidden away. Tracking down this Desire
might be tough, but only we can do it!

column2: Kuon Ichinose, friend of Metaverse scroungers
column3:
I've got one last request for you guys—I'm
looking for a specific kind of junk. Hey, is
it just me, or do you guys seem a lot
stronger than before?
Proceed from the base of the Tree of Knowledge until you reach the Hall of Contracts without using quick travel or alarming enemies.
It seems your past holds a battle even I have not witnessed. There is a path leading to a memory in the Tree of Knowledge. Only your will can decide whether or not you follow it.

The twisted will of the Ark has spawned
cognitive Monarchs all across the land.
Defeat the Monarch of Shibuya once more...
and please, be careful.

The twisted will of the Ark has spawned
cognitive Monarchs all across the land.
Defeat the Monarch of Sendai once more...
and please, be careful.

The twisted will of the Ark has spawned
cognitive Monarchs all across the land.
Defeat the Monarch of Sapporo once more...
and please, be careful.

The twisted will of the Ark has spawned
cognitive Monarchs all across the land.
Defeat the Monarch of Osaka once more...
and please, be careful.

The Ark has evolved even further, creating
a being that surpasses its own power in the
Tree of Knowledge. Defeat the false god,
Demiurge, once more. Fight well, Trickster...

O-O-O-Omigod, there's something in the
Okinawa Jail and its power is... Oh! Could—
Could it be!? Is this... Is it HIM!?
